item.title: South Korean Election Frontrunner Lee Floats Two-Term Presidency
item.description: South Korea’s leading presidential candidate Lee Jae-myung proposed a constitutional amendment to shorten the presidency to four years with a two-term limit, calling it a move to better balance power.
item.dc:creator: Soo-Hyang Choi

media:content.media:description: Lee Jae-myung Photographer: Woohae Cho/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump Loyalist Faces Math Prodigy in Romania Vote: What to Watch
item.description: Romanians elect their next president on Sunday in a contest that will determine the Black Sea nation’s trajectory in Europe as frustration with the political establishment spurs a surge in support for the far right.
item.dc:creator: Irina Vilcu, Andra Timu

media:content.media:description: George Simion, right, casts his ballot beside former candidate Calin Georgescu on May 4. Photographer: Daniel Mihailescu/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Explosion Rocks Fertility Clinic in Palm Springs
item.description: The person believed responsible for an attack targeting a Southern California fertility clinic Saturday posted rambling online writings before an explosion that investigators are treating as an act of terrorism, according to a law enforcement official.

media:content.media:description: Law enforcement officials near the scene of an explosion in Palm Springs, California, on May 17, 2025.

item.title: Fatalities Climb as Tornado, Severe Weather Sweep Through US
item.description: LONDON, Ky. (AP) — At least 27 people have been killed by storms systems that swept across part of the U.S. Midwest and South, with Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear announcing Saturday that 18 of the deaths came in his state and 10 others were hospitalized in critical condition.

media:content.media:description: People survey damage after a severe storm in St. Louis on May 16.

item.title: Sara Duterte Wants Impeachment Trial to Go On, Sees ‘Bloodbath’
item.description: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte wants her impeachment trial to go ahead, days after her allies outperformed at the midterm election that could add to her bloc of supporters in the Senate.
item.dc:creator: Manolo Serapio Jr

media:content.media:description: Sara Duterte Photographer: Jam STA Rosa/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Australia ‘Up for a Deal’ With the EU After Years of Trade Talks
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said Australia is “up for a deal” with the European Union, sounding a note of cautious optimism after years of trade negotiations.
item.dc:creator: Karen Leigh

media:content.media:description: Anthony Albanese Photographer: Brent Lewin/Bloomberg

item.title: Beyond Nvidia, Four Things to Know at Asia’s Biggest Tech Show
item.description: Nvidia Corp.’s Jensen Huang headlines the 2025 edition of Asia’s biggest electronics conference, for years a showcase for his company’s cutting-edge AI chips and the companies lining up to buy them. This year, however, the spotlight may well be on another far bigger personality: US President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Vlad Savov, Jane Lanhee Lee

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang, Nvidia CEO

item.title: UK, EU Wrangle Over Students and Travel Ahead of Reset Summit
item.description: British and European Union negotiators wrangled over measures to ease travel for students, young workers and tourists this weekend, as the two sides raced to resolve policy disputes ahead of a summit meant to reset their fraught relationship.
item.dc:creator: Alex Wickham, Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli

media:content.media:description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, left, and UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer meet last month in Downing Street.

item.title: ECB’s Lagarde Says Euro’s Strength Is Counterintuitive, But Justified
item.description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said the recent rise of the euro against the dollar is a consequence of US President Donald Trump’s erratic policies and an opportunity for Europe.
item.dc:creator: Francois De Beaupuy, Mark Schroers

media:content.media:description: Christine Lagarde

item.title: Merz Sees No Risk of UniCredit Taking Over Commerzbank Currently
item.description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz currently sees no risk that Italy’s UniCredit SpA will be able to take over Commerzbank AG.
item.dc:creator: Arne Delfs, Donato Paolo Mancini

media:content.media:description: Friedrich Merz attends a press conference at Palazzo Chigi, after his meeting with Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, in Rome on May 17.

item.title: Meloni Says She’s No Shrink to Global Leaders as She Meets Merz
item.description: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni said she isn’t a “shrink to international leaders” after she was asked to give advice to German Chancellor Friedrich Merz for his upcoming trip to meet US President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Donato Paolo Mancini, Arne Delfs

media:content.media:description: Friedrich Merz, left, and Giorgia Meloni hold a joint press conference at Palazzo Chigi in Rome on May 17, 2025.

item.title: Trump Administration Drops Southwest Scheduling Lawsuit
item.description: The Trump administration dropped a lawsuit against Southwest Airlines Co. that accused the airline of setting unrealistic flight schedules that led to chronic delays.
item.dc:creator: Robert Burnson

media:content.media:description: A ramp agents walks under the wing of a Southwest Airlines Boeing 737-700 airplane as it is pushed back from the gate for departure at Baltimore-Washington Airport (BWI) in Baltimore, Maryland, US, on Friday, April 12, 2024. Southwest Airlines Co. is scheduled to release earnings figures on April 25.

item.title: New York Republican Floats Higher Tax Rate to Pay for SALT
item.description: A key House Republican who is pushing for a higher cap for state and local tax deductions sought to revive the idea of raising the top rate for high earners to help pay for President Donald Trump’s tax cuts — and to get the stalled legislation moving.
item.dc:creator: Steven T. Dennis

media:content.media:description: Representative Nick LaLota, a Republican from New York, during a House Appropriations Subcommittee on Financial Services and General Government hearing in Washington, DC, US, on Tuesday, May 6, 2025.

item.title: Arab League Summit in Baghdad Has Gaza Topping the Agenda
item.description: BAGHDAD (AP) — Arab leaders at an annual summit in Baghdad called Saturday for an immediate end to Israel's attacks on the Gaza Strip and to allow aid into the Palestinian territories without conditions. They promised to contribute to the reconstruction of the territory once the war stops.

media:content.media:description: A bus destroyed by an Israeli airstrike on May 13 outside the Gaza European Hospital in eastern Khan Younis, southern Gaza, on Wednesday, May 14, 2025. French President Emmanuel Macron accused Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of “shameful” behavior in blocking aid to Gaza, and called on the European Union to toughen its stance against the country.

item.title: Trump Plans Call With Putin to End ‘Bloodbath’ in Ukraine
item.description: President Donald Trump said he’ll have a phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday morning to discuss how to stop the war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Whitelaw, Skylar Woodhouse

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump speaks to members of the media accompanying him aboard Airforce One, after leaving Abu Dhabi at the end of his Middle East tour on May 16, 2025. Trump capped his Gulf tour in Abu Dhabi after signing another raft of multi-billion-dollar deals, while also securing a $1.4 trillion investment pledge from the UAE. (Photo by Brendan SMIALOWSKI / AFP) (Photo by BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Trump Says Walmart Shouldn’t Blame Tariffs for Higher Prices
item.description: President Donald Trump said Walmart Inc. should stop trying to blame tariffs as the reason for raising its prices, as the company warned it would this week.
item.dc:creator: Skylar Woodhouse

media:content.media:description: Shopping carts outside a Walmart store in Richmond, California, US, on Monday, Nov. 18, 2024. Walmart Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on November 19.

item.title: US Says It’s Not Decided Next Steps on NYC’s Congestion Pricing
item.description: The Trump administration urged a federal judge to refrain from blocking the government from taking any action against New York’s congestion pricing program, saying it hasn’t actually done anything yet.
item.dc:creator: Chris Dolmetsch

media:content.media:description: Congestion Relief Zone signage on Park Avenue in New York, US, on Thursday, April 24, 2025. The Trump administration is threatening to stop future federal approvals for transportation projects in Manhattan and may withhold funding if New York City's congestion pricing program continues.

item.title: Trump Says Will Be Speaking to Putin of Russia on Monday
item.description: President Donald Trump says he will be speaking to President Putin on Monday at 10am.
item.dc:creator: Susanne Barton

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump speaks to members of the media accompanying him aboard Airforce One, after leaving Abu Dhabi at the end of his Middle East tour on May 16, 2025. Trump capped his Gulf tour in Abu Dhabi after signing another raft of multi-billion-dollar deals, while also securing a $1.4 trillion investment pledge from the UAE. (Photo by Brendan SMIALOWSKI / AFP) (Photo by BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI/AFP via Getty Images) Photographer: BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI/AFP

item.title: Costly Loss for Sports Team Owners Embedded in Trump Tax Bill
item.description: The owner’s box could soon be less opulent.
item.dc:creator: Billy House

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump attending a game between the NFL Pittsburgh Steelers and the New York Jets in Latrobe, Pennsylvania. Photographer: Evan Vucci/Getty Images

item.title: Kremlin Sets Conditions for Talks, Lavrov Speaks With US’s Rubio
item.description: A meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskiy could take place if the two sides come to certain, unspecified agreements, the Kremlin said.
item.dc:creator: Henry Meyer

media:content.media:description: The domes of Saint Basil's Cathedral in Moscow, Russia, on Tuesday, Feb. 15, 2022. Russia announced the start of a pullback of some forces after drills that raised U.S. and European alarm about a possible military assault on Ukraine. Photographer: Andrey Rudakov/Bloomberg

item.title: Iran’s Khamenei Brands Trump a Liar in Escalation of Rhetoric
item.description: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei accused US President Donald Trump of dishonesty and power abuse, marking the latest rhetorical flare-up between Tehran and the US.
item.dc:creator: Arsalan Shahla

media:content.media:description: TEHRAN, IRAN - MAY 10: (----EDITORIAL USE ONLY MANDATORY CREDIT - 'IRANIAN LEADER PRESS OFFICE / HANDOUT' - NO MARKETING NO ADVERTISING CAMPAIGNS - DISTRIBUTED AS A SERVICE TO CLIENTS----) Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamanei attends an event in Tehran, Iran on May 10, 2025. (Photo by IRANIAN LEADER PRESS OFFICE/Anadolu via Getty Images)

item.title: Israel Starts Gaza Escalation, Sees Movement in Hostage Talks
item.description: Israel advanced its ground forces in Gaza as part of a long-threatened all-out offensive against Hamas, and said the new action prompted the group to resume mediated negotiations on a possible ceasefire and hostage release.
item.dc:creator: Dan Williams, Fares Alghoul

media:content.media:description: Israeli tanks and bulldozers deployed as smoke billows over destroyed buildings in Gaza during Israeli bombardment on May 17.

item.title: Trump’s Deals Cast China Both as Foe and Prize, Blurring Signals
item.description: Pick through the details of recent US trade negotiations and an outline of Donald Trump’s vision for the global economy starts to come into focus. As do its contradictions.
item.dc:creator: Alberto Nardelli, Josh Wingrove

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump, right, and Howard Lutnick, US commerce secretary

item.title: Erdogan Says He’s Hopeful That US Will Relax Defense Sanctions
item.description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is looking for Washington to ease defense sanctions on his country as ties warm up between the NATO allies under the new US administration.
item.dc:creator: Inci Ozbek

media:content.media:description: A US Air Force F-35 fighter jet. Photographer: Bo Amstrup/Getty Images

item.title: North Macedonia Forges £5 Billion Investment Alliance With UK
item.description: North Macedonia is set to receive as much as £5 billion ($6.6 billion) in funding from the UK to support investment in infrastructure and other key sectors, Prime Minister Hristijan Mickoski told reporters in Skopje on Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Slav Okov

media:content.media:description: The business district and Macedonia Square in Skopje, North Macedonia, on Wednesday, Aug. 14, 2024. The North Macedonian economy will expand 2.9% in 2024 according to the latest results of a Bloomberg News survey conducted from July 19 to July 24.

item.title: UK Police Charge Three Iranians With Spying for Tehran
item.description: Three Iranian nationals have been charged with spying for Tehran under Britain’s National Security Act, the Metropolitan Police said.
item.dc:creator: Alex Wickham

media:content.media:description: The Iranian flag is arranged for a photograph in New York, U.S., on Friday, Feb. 21, 2014. Iran and six world powers yesterday agreed in Vienna on a framework for negotiating a comprehensive nuclear agreement, following up on November's interim accord. Photographer: Bloomberg/Bloomberg

item.title: Starmer Set to Retreat on Winter Fuel Payments, I Says
item.description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer is set to soften changes to Labour’s winter fuel payment cut as soon as next month, the I newspaper reported.
item.dc:creator: Shiyin Chen

media:content.media:description: A radiator inside a residential apartment. Photographer: Angel Garcia/Bloomberg

item.title: Europe Waits to See Where Trump Swerves to Next on Russia
item.description: European officials have no idea what President Donald Trump will say next about Russia’s war in Ukraine — or where that may leave them.
item.dc:creator: Alberto Nardelli, Alex Wickham, Natalia Drozdiak, Daryna Krasnolutska

media:content.media:description: In this photo provided by the German Government Press Office, leaders of France, Germany, Poland and the UK joined Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, second from left, in a phone call with US President Donald Trump, in Tirana, Albania, on May 16.

item.title: Australia Condemns Russia’s 13-Year Sentence for Citizen
item.description: Australia’s foreign minister condemned a 13-year prison sentence handed down by a Russian court to an Australian national who fought with Ukrainian forces, calling the process a “sham trial” and vowing to press for his release.
item.dc:creator: Swati Pandey

media:content.media:description: TOPSHOT - Ukrainian servicemen of the 43 Artillery Brigade fire a 2S7 Pion self-propelled cannon towards Russian positions at a front line in the Donetsk region on September 27, 2024, amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine. (Photo by Genya SAVILOV / AFP) (Photo by GENYA SAVILOV/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Turkey’s Celebi Says It’s Cooperating After India Revokes Clearance
item.description: Turkish company Çelebi Aviation said on Saturday it’s “fully cooperating” with Indian authorities and adhering to regulations after its ground handling and cargo warehouse operations were suspended due to national security concerns.
item.dc:creator: Swati Pandey

media:content.media:description: Boarding stairs stand on the tarmac at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport, operated by Adani Group, in Mumbai, India, on Wednesday, May 22, 2024. With a total market capitalization of $213 billion across 10 listed units alone, the conglomerate controls vast swathes of the infrastructure that powers the nation’s growth and underpins the Asian expansion of companies from Apple Inc. to Amazon.com Inc. Photographer: Sumit Dayal/Bloomberg
